properties.project_description: This project will provide for the renovation of the Beacon Center to address deferred repair and replacement needs as well as enhance programming level of service.
properties.project_rationale: This project is needed to address deferred repair and replacement needs as well as enhance programming level of service.
properties.phase_notes: The project is scheduled for completion summer 2024.

properties.project_description: This project is working with BNSF to fix a sinkhole near North 17th and Fir Street.
properties.project_rationale: The current sinkhole is getting larger and needs to be fixed before cost of repair is significant.
properties.phase_notes: This project is in the planning phase.

properties.projname: Portland Avenue Bridge Repair - Span Over BNSF Tracks
properties.project_description: This project consists of installing external post tensioning to improve the load carrying capacity of the bridge.
properties.location_description: Portland Ave and south of River St
properties.project_rationale: This project will preserve the existing structure and allow for load carrying vehicles to utilize it.
properties.phase_notes: This project remains unfunded.

properties.projname: South Sheridan Avenue: 56th to 84th - Complete Street
properties.project_description: This project will complete South Sheridan Avenue as a Complete Street, adding curb, gutters, missing link sidewalks, and street lighting.
properties.location_description: Sheridan Avenue from S 84th St. to S 56th St.
properties.project_rationale: Council requested project to complete missing sidewalks, improve traffic safety and enhance the active transportation connections.
properties.phase_notes: This program is divided into phases, Missing Links Sidewalks from S 84th to S 72nd complete, S 72nd to S 64th is in design, and S 64th to S 56th is in preliminary design.

properties.project_description: Package 37 mainly involves the construction or replacement of concrete panels, curb ramps, and conduit in various locations across Tacoma.

Crews will grind out sections of pavement to make minor repairs and prepare the surface for the placement of a 2-inch layer of asphalt over the existing street surface. ADA curb ramp upgrades will also be made at this time if applicable.

Power Generation projects include work at Tacoma Power's four hydroelectric generating projects (Cowlitz, Cushman, Nisqually, and Wynoochee Projects) and the associated recreational facilities, fish hatcheries and other project lands.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Projects support reliable operations and licensing requirements of Tacoma Power Hydro projects and associated facilities. Consistent with Tacoma Power's 10-Year Capital Plan.

properties.project_description: Power Management manages Tacoma Power's long and short term power supply portfolio to meet customer needs. Energy conservation is the primary project. This is an ongoing program.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Provides energy conservation services to Tacoma Power customers as required by the Energy Independence Act. Consistent with Tacoma Power's 10-Year Capital Plan.

properties.project_description: Locomotive repowers to continue to modernize Tacoma Rail's locomotive fleet.
properties.project_rationale:
Operations/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Projects provide necessary additions, replacements, and improvements to Tacoma Rail facilities and equipment.

properties.project_description: Capital projects eligible for cost-sharing with the partners in the Regional Water Supply System. Project costs include First Diversion and RWSS related project costs including: Howard Hanson Dam Additional Water Storage and North Fork Well Upgrades.
properties.project_rationale:
Policy/Legislative Requirements, Federal/State Mandates
Consistent with the Tacoma Water Comprehensive Water System, Second Supply Partnership
Agreement, Muckleshoot Indian Tribe Agreements, Repayment, and Tacoma Water Habitat.
properties.phase_notes: Ongoing

properties.project_description: These projects rehabilitate or replace existing stormwater collection pipes within the City's 578-mile network of underground pipes.
properties.project_rationale: These improvements will maintain and replace aging underground pipes that are no longer reliable and are too costly to maintain.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified through the Environmental Services Asset Management Program.

properties.project_description: This project includes a new transit center with six bus bays, shelter, layover space, and passenger amenities. The project is expected to be phased with phase 1 including a location study and preliminary design.
Multiple track relays, switch replacements, and rail rehabilitation projects.
properties.project_rationale:
Operations/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Projects provide additions, replacements and improvements to Tacoma Rail track and track related infrastructure.

properties.project_description: Transmission & Distribution Projects include those associated with electrical transmission lines, distribution lines and related substations. Some sample projects include 230 kV System reliability improvements and downtown infrastructure development.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Projects provide additions, replacements and improvements to the transmission & distribution systems. Consistent with Tacoma Power's 10-Year Capital Plan.

properties.project_description: Various projects that will install water quality or flow control facilities to include green stormwater infrastructure to improve localized flooding and improve water quality.
properties.project_rationale: These projects will support NPDES requirements and support various local, state, and federal green stormwater initiatives.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified through the Environmental Services Asset Management program.

properties.project_description: Utility Technology Services projects include those associated with networks, communications, operational systems and other utility business systems. Sample projects include enhancements of communication systems and equipment.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Projects provide additions, replacements and improvements to communications, operation systems and other utility business systems. Consistent with Tacoma Power's 10-Year Capital Plan.
properties.phase_notes: Ongoing

properties.project_description: Upgrading/renewing Tacoma Water's distribution system through capital programs such as Public Road Projects; Distribution Main Upgrade/Renewal/Retirements; LIDs; Hydrant Upgrade/Replacement; and Water Service Replacement/Renewal.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Consistent with the Tacoma Water Comprehensive Water System Plan.
properties.phase_notes: Ongoing

properties.project_description: Projects to maintain the quality of Tacoma Water's supply includes Watershed Management and Corrosion Control. Projects that are cost share eligible with the Regional Water Supply System appear under the title "RWSS Cost Share Eligible Projects".
properties.project_rationale:
Policy/Legislative Requirements, Federal/State Mandates
Consistent with the Tacoma Water Comprehensive Water System Plan and Muckleshoot Indian Tribe Agreement.
properties.phase_notes: Ongoing

properties.project_description: Projects to construct, upgrade, and renew Tacoma Water's supply system include: Groundwater Prioritization programs; Pipeline 1 Pressurization; Seismic Facilities Upgrades; Pump Station and Tank Installation
properties.project_rationale:
Policy/Legislative Requirements, Federal/State Mandates
Consistent with the Tacoma Water Comprehensive Water System Plan.
properties.phase_notes: Ongoing

properties.project_description: Historic FS #11 was constructed in 1909, the existing station is obsolete and lacks the requirements of a modern fire station. This project will provide for design and construction to renovate and expand the historic station.
properties.project_rationale: The station is in critical condition and in need of a renovation. The existing site has capacity to expand to meet the growing emergency response needs of the community.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project will provide for future improvements to Chinese Reconciliation Park.
properties.project_rationale: Continuation of the Chinese Reconciliation Park construction. This site is important in expressing the need for acceptance and reconciliation for the events of 1885.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: 15th Street Moorage and Waterway Park Launch
properties.project_description: Design a replacement for the 15th Street wood warf. The current structure is a floated gangway and is deteriorating. The new warf will be designed for lanuching human powered craft.
properties.project_rationale: Improvement of the Foss Waterway

properties.project_description: Installation of new and updates to existing safety and security infrastructure.
properties.project_rationale: Safety and security needs in public assembly facilities have significantly changed since facilty opened.

properties.project_description: Historic FS #4 was constructed in 1935, the existing station is obsolete and lacks the requirements of a modern fire station. This project will provide for design and construction to renovate and expand the historic station.
properties.project_rationale: The station is in poor condition and in need of renovation. The existing site has capacity to expand to meet the growing emergency response needs of the community.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project will provide for refurbishment and cleaning of the exterior of the historic Tacoma Municipal Building and Municipal Building North.
properties.project_rationale: The exterior of the Municipal Complex needs extensive repair and restoration to address accelerated deterioration.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently in the design phase.

properties.project_description: The PW Maint Campus is located in the Brewery District economic revitalization area. Identifying and acquiring property for the relocation of the PW Maint Campus will enable the existing site to be marketed for economic and housing opportunities.
properties.location_description: TBD - Current location 2308 S Holgate St
properties.project_rationale: The existing Maint Campus has been identified as a catalyst site for the development of the Brewery District.  Relocation of maintenance operations will allow for the current site to be marketed for adaptive reuse, mixed-use development and housing.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently in the planning phase.

properties.project_description: The Main library's boiler is inefficient, old, and at risk of failing.  Funding is needed to modernize this vital piece of equipment.
properties.project_rationale: The boiler at the Main Library is out of date and inefficient.  A replacement is needed to ensure staff and patrons can occupy the branch comfortably year-round.
properties.phase_notes: Project is the feasibility phase.

properties.projname: Performing Arts Theaters Capital Projects Management
properties.project_description: This funding provides funding capital improvements at the Pantages, Rialto, Theater On The Square and the Jones Building, including repair, replacement, and other facility upgrades and improvements.
properties.project_rationale: The outcomes achieved by the City’s investments will preserve and improve these nearly century-old, national historic landmarks, and hubs of economic impact.
properties.phase_notes: The current phase of this project has upgraded roofing, interior upgrades, and rehabilitation of water infiltration in the Rialto Theater.

properties.project_description: This project will advance the City's Climate Action Plan (CAP) goals to advance decarbonization/electrification by replacing fossil-fuel building systems that are at the end of their useful life with 100% electric energy efficient systems.
properties.project_rationale: The Tacoma Police Department headquarters building emits over 250 metric tons of CO2 annually which is 10% of the City’s commercial building emissions. The building Energy Use Intensity (EUI) is 67% over the state‐mandated target as established in the Washington Clean Buildings Performance Standard. The building’s systems are nearing the end of their useful life and are in need of replacement.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: Solid Waste Management Facilities Upgrades and Maintenance
properties.project_description: Provides funds for capital improvement projects associated with the operational needs of the Solid Waste Utility which include improvements and repairs to existing facilities and upgrades to traffic flow and scale houses.
properties.project_rationale: Projects under this program provide the necessary infrastructure for the City to provide solid waste collection and disposal services.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified through the Environmental Services' asset management program.

properties.project_description: In 21-22 TPL proposed reducing the Main footprint as a way to make ongoing operational reductions.  Funding is needed to create spaces for partner agencies to operate and produce programming, and to move all library functions to the 1st floor and NW Room.
properties.project_rationale: In 21-22 TPL proposed reducing the Main footprint as a way to make ongoing operational reductions.  Funding is needed to create spaces for partner agencies to operate and produce programming, and to move all library functions to the 1st floor and NW Room.
properties.phase_notes: Project is in construction phase and is expected to be finished Aug 2024

properties.project_description: The Greater Tacoma Convention Center is an important element and economic driver located in downtown Tacoma. It requires periodic upgrades to keep up with the general wear and tear of the building as well as improvements to keep pace with the competitive convention center market. This project envisions general upgrades needed to keep the building operation and maintain a welcoming environment for patrons and visitors.
properties.project_rationale: The 119,000 square foot building sees many events per year. Maintaining and updating this facility requires continued investment, mostly from the Public Facilities District.

properties.project_description: FS #7 lacks expansion capability to meet the requirements of a modern fire station. Property acquisition phase is funded, this request will provide for final design and construction of a new station.
properties.project_rationale: Fire Station No. 7 is currently located in a shared library facility that has no room for expansion to meet the growing emergency response needs of the community.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently in the planning and property acquisition phase.

properties.project_description: This project will rebuild all eight library branches.
properties.project_rationale: TPL's 8 branches are, on avg, 68 years old and, on avg, have been last remodeled 30 years ago. The designs are impractical, do not meet modern design standards, lack the aesthetics and functionality needed to make TPL a radically welcoming organization.
properties.phase_notes: Project is the feasibility phase.

properties.project_description: Establishment of brand identity for the Parking System including new signage and garage placemaking.
properties.project_rationale: Branding will enhance the public’s image and use of the City owned parking facilities.
properties.phase_notes: Project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: These projects maintain and or replace aging pump station infrastructure and equipment that is either no longer reliable and or is excessively costly to maintain.
properties.project_rationale: These improvements will maintain and replace aging infrastructure and equipment that is no longer reliable or is too costly to maintain. Projects may increase the effectiveness of wastewater treatment and reduce operation and maintenance costs.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified through the Environmental Services Asset Management program.

properties.project_description: This project would provide for improvements to the Tacoma Fire Department’s portfolio of facilities.  Facility improvements range from repair & replacements, renovations, and new facilities.  This project would provide for the remaining fire facility improvement projects not specifically identified in the Capital Facilities Plan.
properties.project_rationale: This project will implement the recommendations of the Fire Facilities Master Plan and Standards of Cover study completed in 2024.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This program will provide for office remodels and reconfigurations.  Many facilities have not undergone significant improvements in decades and are in need of improvement.
properties.project_rationale: This program will provide for office and interior improvements to the Municipal Complex and other facilities. Including reconfigurations, replacing finishes, furnishings, and building elements that are beyond their useful life.
properties.phase_notes: This is an ongoing program to provide reconfigurations and remodels to tenant space.

properties.project_description: These projects rehabilitate or replace existing wastewater collection pipes within the City's 697-mile network of underground pipes.
properties.project_rationale: These improvements will maintain and replace aging underground pipes that are no longer reliable and are too costly to maintain.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified through the Environmental Services Asset Management Program.

properties.project_description: Deferred maintenance needs identified for the facility including superstructure repairs and interior finishes.
properties.project_rationale: Highly performing and safe facilities are important for the continued success of the Parking System.  Addressing the deferred maintenance needs of each facility will prolong the usable life and enhance public safety for users of the facilities.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: A Street Parking Garage Lighting Upgrade
properties.project_description: LED lighting upgrade for the A Street Parking Garage.
properties.project_rationale: Highly performing and safe facilities are important for the continued success of the Parking System.  Addressing the deferred maintenance needs of each facility will prolong the usable life and enhance public safety for users of the facilities.

properties.project_description: Deferred maintenance needs identified for the facility including site improvements and electrical utility upgrades.

properties.project_rationale: Highly performing and safe facilities are important for the continued success of the Parking System.  Addressing the deferred maintenance needs of each facility will prolong the usable life and enhance public safety for users of the facilities.
properties.phase_notes: Project is currently unfuned.

properties.project_description: FS #15 has been operating from a temporary facility and is in need of a purpose built facility to serve the Eastside and South End of Tacoma. This project will provide for design and construction of a new station.
properties.project_rationale: TFD has an ongoing operational need for a permanent Fire Station serving East Tacoma.  The temporary station is inefficient, lacks capacity for growth and does not meet long term operational needs.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_rationale: Highly performing and safe facilities are important for the continued success of the Parking System.  Addressing the deferred maintenance needs of each facility will prolong the usable life and enhance public safety for users of the facilities.

properties.project_description: These projects maintain or replace aging infrastructure and equipment that is either no longer reliable and/or is excessively costly to maintain. Several of these projects will also provide new infrastructure
properties.location_description: North End Treatment Plant, 4002 N. Waterview Street
properties.project_rationale: These improvements will maintain and replace aging infrastructure and equipment that is no longer reliable or is too costly to maintain. Projects may increase the effectiveness of wastewater treatment and reduce operation and maintenance costs.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified as part of the Environmental Services Asset Management Program.

properties.project_description: Renovate to code highly visible City-owned space on the ground floor of the Park Plaza North Garage at Pacific Avenue adjacent to the City Parking Services Office for potential office, retail or service tenants
properties.project_rationale: Strategic Plan Objectives; Project supports the Strategic Plan for Community Development
properties.phase_notes: This funding will help to revitalize a long vacant prominent space in the downtown core with significant barriers to occupancy due to building code challenges and enable job creation.

properties.project_description: Deferred maintenance needs identified for the facility including superstructure repairs, interior finishes, elevator replacement, and electrical repairs.
properties.project_rationale: Highly performing and safe facilities are important for the continued success of the Parking System.  Addressing the deferred maintenance needs of each facility will prolong the usable life and enhance public safety for users of the facilities.

properties.project_description: Renovate Exhibition Hall and Lobby.  Replacement of mechanical, plumbing and electrical systems, surfaces, fixtures, furniture and equipment.
properties.project_rationale: The Exhibition Hall no longer serves our clients needs.  Renovation to include mechanical, electrical and layout enhancements.
properties.phase_notes: Project is unfunded.

properties.project_description: Restore Veterans Plaza to original purpose of honoring our veterans.  Replace plantings and brick work.
properties.project_rationale: Restore the Veterans plaza to pay tribute to US troops and veterans.
properties.phase_notes: Project is unfunded.

properties.project_description: Repave surface lots outside of Tacoma Dome
properties.project_rationale: Several parking lots surrounding the Dome have significant pot holes and need restriping.
properties.phase_notes: Project is proposed for funding in the 2025-2026 Budget.

properties.project_description: Installation of new and updates to existing safety and security infrastructure.
properties.project_rationale: Safety and security needs in public assembly facilities have significantly changed since facilty opened.
properties.phase_notes: Project is unfunded.

properties.project_description: A 10,000 sq. ft. addition to provide adaquate and equitable restrooms for guests and waste management solution to meet current environmental and waste diversion goals.
properties.project_rationale: Restrooms on the concourse are not at current bulding code levels.  Waste stream management area is needed to achieve City Council climate change resolutions.
properties.phase_notes: Concept design for this proposed project has been completed.

properties.project_description: This project includes planning, design, permitting, remediation and construction of the future Waterway Park and rowing center on the Foss Waterway.
properties.project_rationale: Tied to the Foss Master Plan, an element of the City's Shoreline Master Plan in the Comprehensive Plan. Funding from Metro Parks and other organizations may provide matching funds with grant potential and private funding potential.
properties.phase_notes: Project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project would construct a skatepark under the I705 overpass near the Prairie Line Trail.
properties.location_description: I-705 overpass, near the Prairie Line Trail (1551 PACIFIC AVE)
properties.project_rationale: This project was selected through a participatory budgeting project, with votes from people who live, work, and play in Council District 2.

properties.project_description: This program provides for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, and execution of affordable housing projects with city limits.
properties.location_description: Various Locations. CED office: 747 Market St
properties.project_rationale: Affordable Housing is an important need in Tacoma and the Puget Sound region. The organization must ensure it utilizes all its tools to address this complex issue.
properties.phase_notes: This is a new project.

properties.project_description: This project supports capital improvements to the City of Tacoma's 43 bridges. This includes replacement, rehabilitation,  and maintenance of all bridges.
properties.project_rationale: Keeping Tacoma's bridges open and operating is necessary for the movement of people, freight, and goods throughout the City.
properties.phase_notes: This project remains unfunded.

properties.project_description: Upgrading Tacoma Rail's radio system with a radio repeater system and installing more remote health and location monitoring systems on locomotives.
properties.project_rationale: "Operations/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency Projects provide necessary additions, replacements, and improvements to Tacoma Rail facilities and equipment."

properties.project_description: This project will address deferred repair and replacement needs of existing downtown fountains, through removals and/or system refurbishments.
properties.project_rationale: There are four existing fountains in the downtown area that have extensive deferred repair and replacement needs. Three of the four fountains are non-operations due to the extent of deferred repairs and may be beyond reconditioning.
properties.phase_notes: The project is proposed for funding in the 2025-2026 Biennial Budget.

properties.projname: East 11th Street Bridge Demolition over the Puyallup River
properties.project_description: This project removes the existing bridge over the Puyallup River as well as the east and west approaches from Portland Ave to Milwaukee Ave.
properties.project_rationale: This project includes demolition of the existing truss over the Puyallup River.
properties.phase_notes: This project remains unfunded

properties.project_description: Provides funding for Stormwater Facilities Projects to include upgraded pump stations and holding basins. Various projects to provide periodic ongoing maintenance, rehabilitation, or upgrades to existing stormwater facilities throughout the city.
properties.project_rationale: These improvements will maintain and replace aging infrastructure and equipment that is no longer reliable or is too costly to maintain.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified as part of the Environmental Services Asset Management Program.

properties.project_description: Replacing Tacoma Rail's west end track pans and stormwater treatment and filtration and upgrading the secondary fueling facility and Tacoma Rail's portion of the Tideflats Intelligent Transportation Systems.
properties.project_rationale: "Operations/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency Projects provide necessary additions, replacements, and improvements to Tacoma Rail facilities and equipment."

properties.project_description: Safety and security is a priority for the Tacoma Fire Department. This project will provide for the installation of access controls and other security enhancements to the existing fire facilities.
properties.project_rationale: Current facilities are utilizing obsolete and unsecure cypher locks that are past their useful life. This project will replace existing door hardware with modern card access readers enhancing security and control.
properties.phase_notes: Planning phase

properties.project_description: Capital Projects related to upgrading various Tacoma Water facilities and equipment. General capital projects include: Advanced Meter Infrastructure (AMI); Various technology upgrades;  and Fleet or Land Purchases.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Consistent with Tacoma Water Comprehensive Water System Plan
Modernization efforts resulting in increases in billing, reporting, and detection capabilities.
properties.phase_notes: Ongoing

properties.project_description: General Plant projects include additions, replacements, improvements to general facilities, and Tacoma Power Fleet Replacements.
properties.project_rationale:
Operation/Maintenance Needs, Capacity/Level of Service/Concurrency
Projects provide necessary additions, replacements and improvements to Tacoma Power general plant facilities and equipment. Consistent with Tacoma Power 10-Year Capital Plan.

properties.project_description: This project provides for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, and execution of homlessness sheltering projects within city limits.
properties.project_rationale: Homelessness is an important need in Tacoma and the Puget Sound region. The organization must ensure it utilizes all its tools to address this complex issue.
properties.phase_notes: This is a new project.

properties.project_description: Funds to cost-share off-site improvements and/or seismic retrofits to enable the development of affordable housing and job creation projects in Tacoma that may not otherwise occur due to inadequate public infrastructure or life safety concerns.
properties.project_rationale:
Policy/Legislative Requirements, Strategic Plan Objectives
Project supports the Strategic Plan for Community Development
properties.phase_notes: This funding for catalytic redevelopment will be allocated to projects that yield a significant economic benefit to the community as they are identified.

properties.project_description: This project will renovate all eight library branches and include new electrical, mechanical, plumbing, and networking systems, as well as new layouts, carpet, paint, furniture and fixtures, etc.
properties.project_rationale: TPL's 8 branches are, on avg, 68 years old and, on avg, have been last remodeled 30 years ago. The designs are impractical, do not meet modern design standards, lack the aesthetics and functionality needed to make TPL a radically welcoming organization.
properties.phase_notes: Project is the feasibility phase.

properties.projname: Minority Business Development Agency - Tacoma Business Center
properties.project_description: US Commerce Department Funding to support minority businesses with technical assistance and access to capital.
properties.project_rationale: The project supports small and minority-owned business, a City Council Priority. The project is focused on equity.
properties.phase_notes: Cooperative agreemend is signed, funding is confirmed through 2026.

properties.project_description: This project will remove and replace the existing deck to repair existing delaminations and potholes.  The project will also add new AASHTO compliant handrails and a railroad throw fence.
properties.location_description: Between E Lincoln and Puyallup avenue over the BNSF rail yard.
properties.project_rationale: The project deck is approximately 3.4%, well above the federal required 2% level for funding.  The project would make a good candidate for federal funds through the local bridge program funding grants.
properties.phase_notes: This project will apply for grant funding in the 2025 Bridge Program call for projects.

properties.projname: Municipal Building North Energy Efficiency Measures
properties.project_description: This project will advance the City's Climate Action Plan (CAP) goals to reduce energy by replacing inefficient building systems that are at the end of their useful life with 100% electric energy efficient systems.
properties.project_rationale: The Tacoma Municipal Building North rooftop air handling units are energy inefficient, reaching the end of their useful life and are in need of replacement.  This project would replace the rooftop air handling units with 100% electric energy efficient system, eliminating the need for natural gas at the facility.
properties.phase_notes: The project is partially funded.

properties.project_description: The Historic Rialto Theater, located in the downtown Tacoma Theater District, was constructed in 1918. The theater has seen some renovations over the course of its life but is in need of repair. The renovation of the Rialto would include redesigning and upgrading the main seating area, improving accessibility for all patrons, updating the backstage areas, and modernizing the stage and equipment. Upgrades are also needed to interior building systems. A recently completed roofing project helped the state of the building envelope, but a renovation project would examine whether additional upgrades are needed in this area.
properties.project_rationale: The Historic Rialto Theater is the building, of the three City-owned theaters, that is in most need of investment and upgrade.

properties.project_description: The People's Center in the Hilltop neighborhood is a community center owned by the City of Tacoma and managed by MetroParks Tacoma. The center hosts many community activities, fitness and swim classes, and more. The building was constructed in the 1960s and has seen some modest improvements over the years. Most recently in 2015, the pool area was upgraded. The building is showing its age and is in need of repair. The City is working with MetroParks Tacoma to craft a community visioning effort, and, eventually a new future plan for the People's Center site.
properties.project_rationale: The People's Center is in need of repair and replacement, like many City-owned facilities. It requires significant investment to repair and replace aspects of the building systems, envelope, and publicly accessible areas.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: Located in Northeast Tacoma near the Kobetich Library location, Station #3 would be renovated to add additional apparatus bay space and update and improve interior spaces for firefighter health and safety. Renovating and adding to Station 3 would add one apparatus bay, better delineates hot and cold zones, provides gender neutral living quarters.
properties.project_rationale: This project is part of a system-wide upgrade to fire facilities to upgrade the interior spaces for firefighter safety and improve response time.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: Station 2 is located at the south end of Downtown, at the intersection of S 27th Street and S Jefferson Ave. This project would renovate the historic building structure and preserves the facade while maximizing the current space for a ladder truck and accommodating additional fleet parking in the basement. This project would preserve historic building and complete major structural, and envelope upgrades, maximize current space for ladder truck, accommodate new units with a reconfigured basement and provide gender neutral living quarters and better delineates hot and cold zones.
properties.project_rationale: This project is part of a system-wide upgrade to fire facilities to upgrade interior spaces for firefighter safety and improve response times.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project replaces the 11th Street bridge over the mouth of the Puyallup River.
properties.location_description: E 11th St from Portland Ave to Milwaukee
properties.project_rationale: This bridge is currently closed due to deterioration.  This project will replace this deteriorated bridge.
properties.phase_notes: This project remains unfunded.

properties.projname: Library Physical Infrastructure and Building Repairs
properties.project_description: Roofs for 2 buildings, extensive exterior repair on 3 buildings, window replacement on 2 buildings, and HVAC replacement for 3 buildings.
properties.project_rationale: Six libraries are in major disrepair; further deferral will result in deteriorative/structural damage.  Funding will prevent costly/ineffective 'Band-Aid' repairs, reduce utility costs, protect COT assets & library materials, & eliminate unsightly damage.
properties.phase_notes: This project is updating facility issues at various library locations.

properties.project_description: Remove and replace the existing deck.  Provide AASHTO compliant hand rail and add a rail road throw fence.
properties.location_description: It is located between Schuster Parkway and Dock Street.
properties.project_rationale: The current deck has approximately 2.3% deck delaminations.  This is above the federally recommended amount for funding.  Replacing the deck will add 50 years or more to its life.

properties.project_description: Replace the current 70 plus year old fan with a wall of fans for the existing supply air handler at the Main Library. This project is a component of the Main Remodel upgrades.
properties.project_rationale: Replacement of a outdated 70 year old extra-large fan for the existing supply air handler with a bank of multiple fans at the Main Library.
properties.phase_notes: This project will complete updates to the Main Library location and is proposed for funding in the 2025-2026 Biennium.

properties.project_description: This project will be phased over 6 years and will replacing 34,000-LF of wastewater mains in South Tacoma.  The area will be South 58th Street to South 78th Street from Warner Street to Wapato Street.
properties.location_description: South 58th Street to South 78th Street from Warner Street to Wapato Street
properties.project_rationale: Based on the condition of the existing 75-year-old concrete wastewater mains, 34,000-LF of 8-inch mains will be replaced.  This project will also increase the capacity and efficiency of the system.
properties.phase_notes: This project will be phased over the next 6 years. Design on two of the areas in underway with construction on the first area begin at the end of 2024 into 2025.

properties.project_description: These projects maintain or replace aging infrastructure and equipment that is either no longer reliable and/or is excessively costly to maintain. Several of these projects will also provide new infrastructure.
properties.location_description: Tacoma Central Treatment Plant - 2301 Cleveland Way, Tacoma, WA 98421
properties.project_rationale: These improvements will maintain and replace aging infrastructure and equipment that is not long reliable or is too costly to maintain. Projects may increase the effectiveness of wastewater treatment and reduce operation and maintenance costs.
properties.phase_notes: Projects are identified as part of the Environmental Services Asset Management Program.

properties.project_description: Acquire property for development of rail intermodal yard for transport of municipal solid waste to new disposal site upon closure of LRI landfill.
properties.project_rationale: By 2030, Solid Waste anticipates the closure of the LRI landfill. This has prompted the department to find an alternative location and method of transportation to dispose of City garbage. Currently, the most viable option is to train refuse thus requiring a new means of transportation.
properties.phase_notes: Project is in the planning phase.

properties.project_description: This project will provide for a Facility Master Plan for the Tacoma Police Department, providing long-term planning to meet the future needs of the Department.
properties.project_rationale: This project will provide for a Facility Master Plan for the Tacoma Police Department, providing for a comprehensive long-term facilities plan. Tacoma Police Headquarters and Police Substations are approaching their 20th year of continuous operations and are in need of evaluation to ensure facilities meet the Department's operational needs and goals.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: Historic FS #10 was constructed in 1928, the existing station is obsolete and lacks the requirements of a modern fire station. This project will provide for design and construction of a new station at a new location.
properties.project_rationale: Historic Fire Station No. 10 is undersized and has no room for expansion to meet the growing emergency response needs of the community.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description:
Fire Station #6 is located in the Tideflats and covers emergency response in the Port and Downtown areas. This project would renovate and adding to the current location. The site can accommodate an addition, which includes two new private dormitories and a dedicated fitness room. The renovation allows for separation between cold and hot zones and private dorms for all staff. While this concept retains the double-stacked 
apparatus bay, renovating and adding to Station 6 was found to be the 
most feasible option. Renovating and adding to Station 6 helps supports growth through an addition, provides gender neutral living quarters, and allows better delineation of hot and cold zones.
properties.project_rationale: This project is part of the system-wide upgrade of fire station facilities to improve conditions within stations and reduce response times.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description:
Station 14 is currently located in a historic building on a tight site, neither of which can meet long-term space needs, so relocation is required to address calls in Northwest Tacoma. Therefore, relocating Station 14 and building a new two-story station is the 
recommended alternative. This new station would help covers response gaps in Northwest Tacoma and could alleviates pressure on the response system. The City is in discussions with Tacoma Public Schools on potential sites for this new facility, which could include excess property near Point Defiance Elementary School. Coordination and discussions on this potential site are ongoing.
properties.location_description: Northwest Tacoma, potentially on TPS property near Point Defiance Elementary School. Current location is 4701 N 41st
properties.project_rationale: 'Historic Fire Station No. 14 is undersized and has no room for expansion to meet the growing emergency response needs of the community.
properties.phase_notes: The project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project would construct a new Eastside Library branch location for the Tacoma Public Libraries system.
properties.project_rationale: This project would add expanded services to the Eastside neighborhood.
properties.phase_notes: This project is still in the visioning phase and is subject to the availability of funding.

properties.project_description: This project would fund the design, planning, construction, and equipping of a new Hilltop library branch to expand services in that neighborhood.
properties.project_rationale: This project would provide location for the Hilltop community.
properties.phase_notes: This project is subject to the availability of funds.

properties.project_description: This program will address priority repair and replacement needs of City-owned facilities. Priority need projects will focus on asset preservation, historic facilities and critical building systems.
properties.project_rationale: This program will address priority repair & replacement needs to City-owned facilities, including Police, Fire, Public Works, City Hall and Community Service Facilities.
properties.phase_notes: This program is making progress on the City's facility repair and replacement needs.

properties.projname: CityNet MPLS Phase 2 - HFC Network Replacement
properties.project_description: Replacement of 18 network locations migrating from HFC to MPLS
properties.project_rationale: Replacement of outdated network technology to improve CityNet operation

properties.project_description: Crews will lay down a layer of hot liquid asphalt, followed with a layer of clean gravel and finish by rolling the gravel into the asphalt.
properties.location_description: Work will be performed primarily in the area from Tyler Street to Sheridan Avenue and South 56th to South 84th streets.

properties.project_description: This preventative maintenance project will focus on crack sealing and localized pavement repair to maintain the good condition of the street and extend its usable life.
properties.location_description: Work will be performed primarily in the area from Orchard to Portland Ave and South 56th to 96th Streets.

properties.project_description: This project will provide complete streets enhancements on 6th Ave, including pedestrian and transit improvements. Bike improvements may include separated bike facilities on 6th Avenue and/or neighborhood greenways on parallel streets.
properties.location_description: 6th Ave from S Grant Ave to Jackson Ave
properties.project_rationale: This project provides an important east-west bike connection and improves safety, accessibility, and access to transit.
properties.phase_notes: Separated bike lanes between State St and Ainsworth are part of the 6th & Sprague intersection project (PM Jon Kulju).   The remaining segments are unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project would calm traffic, enhance multimodal access, and improve safety by adding bicycle facilities and pedestrian safety and access improvements. This project is likely to be phased.
properties.location_description: S 84th St from S Hosmer St to McKinley Ave
properties.project_rationale: This project supports the City's Local Road Safety Plan and Safe Routes to School Action Plan to provide safe and complete multimodal access for active transportation and youth. Staff have walked the corridor with the South End Neighborhood Council to discuss alignment with their safety and accessibility goals.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded. PW-Transportation applied for a  WSDOT Pedestrian Bicycle grant in 2022, but did not receive it.

properties.project_description: This project is focused on the preservation and maintenance of Tacoma's existing arterial streets in order to extend pavement life cycles in a cost-effective manner.
properties.project_rationale: The basis is to justify the planning of street preservation projects and the pursuit of funding for those project as opportunities arise.
properties.phase_notes: This project is partially funded.  Funds from Streets Initiative programs are set aside for partial design and grant match.

properties.projname: City Support for Tacoma to Puyallup Regional Trail Connection
properties.project_description: This project will continue the City's support for the Tacoma to Puyallup Regional Trail Connection project.
properties.project_rationale: This project, led by WSDOT, is critical to providing a connection to adjacent jurisdictions and other regional trails.
properties.phase_notes: The City continues to work closely with WSDOT, the Puyallup Tribe, Fife & Puyallup on trail implementation. Most of the City's portion of the trail is covered under Puyallup Ave - this project covers any additional asks for funding partnership.

properties.project_description: This project preserves and maintains existing streets across the City of Tacoma based on pavement ratings, cost-effectiveness, and the principles of asset management.
properties.project_rationale: This primary goal of this project is to extend pavement life cycles at the lowest possible cost and improve the overall quality of the street network.
properties.phase_notes: This project is supported by Transportation Benefit District funds and the 2015 Streets Initiative programs.

properties.project_description: This is a multiagency project focused on transportation demand management (TDM) programs in regional growth centers, manufacturing/industrial centers, local centers of importance, and the corridors serving them. The programs will vary by agency but they will have a common goal to educate and influence people's travel behavior between home, work, services and recreation trips. The City of Tacoma will be the lead agency working in partnership with the cities of Fircrest, Puyallup, and University Place. The agencies will implement TDM elements that are appropriate for each jurisdiction. TDM elements include: In Motion, residential outreach programs focused on difficult to reach populations (e.g. low income, low English proficiency populations); Live Close to Work Program; Education & encouragement (e.g. Bike Month, Open Streets Events, center-based bicycle parking programs); Education & encouragement campaigns (e.g. bike safety, TDM, cost effectiveness).
properties.project_rationale: This project supports the City's vision to enhance transportation equity by reducing barriers to using active transportation and transit and increasing access to healthy and affordable transportation. By reducing vehicle miles travelled, this project will reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve public health.
properties.phase_notes: Implementation began in 2022 with community events & outreach led by a part-time Active Transportation Intern. The City is in the process of hiring a full-time grant-funded Active Transportation Community Engagement Coordinator to continue implementation.

properties.project_description: This project will evaluate, prioritize, and construct east/west bikeway connections south of S 38th St. This project is in coordination with I-5  Active Transportation Crossing Program.
properties.location_description: East/west bicycle connection south of S 38th St (location TBD)
properties.project_rationale: This project is critial to providing a safe east-west connection in the south end of the City, where there are limited to no connections.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

Will coordinate with Street Initiative for paving and LID 7732 for UG wiring. Created by ord 28745 on 3/23/2021. Anticipate construction starting in 2026 and continuing into 2027.

properties.project_description: This project will complete missing link sidewalks and pedestrian enhancements with a focus on providing continuous sidewalk access to Schools, Parks and Community Centers, in collaboration with Vision Zero High Injury Networks, 15 Minute Neighborhoods, and Safe Routes to Schools

properties.phase_notes: Funding has been allocated to construct missing link sidewalk as part of the S Cedar St Active Transportation Improvements, S 38th St and S Cedar St Pedestrian Improvement Project, S 2nd St Missing Link Sidewalk, and the Baker SRTS project (pending grant)

properties.project_rationale: Tacoma Power replaced their infrastructure with monopoles allowing reconfiguration of N. 21st and addition of non-motorized facilities.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently in the design phase.

properties.project_description: This project primarily includes a grind/overlay of Northshore Pkwy from easterly city limits to Nassau Ave NE. The project will include installation of compliant curb ramps and driveway approaches.
properties.project_rationale: Roadway is in poor condition and grant opportunities are available.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: The project will improve/include street and pedestrian lighting, sidewalks, banners poles, bike lanes, 2-3 mid-block crossings, traffic calming (49th, 52nd, 48th), bus shelters, wayfinding, and streetscape.
properties.location_description: N Pearl St between 46th St & Park Ave
properties.project_rationale: This project will improve pedestrian and bicycle safety, while encouraging economic development.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project includes infrastructure improvements such as landscaping, green street-scaping, de-paving, and street repair in the South Tacoma Business District.
properties.project_rationale:
"Policy/Legislative Requirements, City Council Directives
City Council Priority Project Area"
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description:
The project will result in the completion of a corridor plan for the Loop Road concept and active transportation connections to the Loop Road in the Tacoma Mall Regional Growth Center. The Loop Road will create a safer and more usable environment for pedestrians, bicycles and other active transportation modes; connecting land uses with each other and creating a larger sense of home in the Tacoma Mall Neighborhood. Connections from the
Loop Road to the Water Flume trail and the S 37th St I-5 pedestrian bridge will also be
included in the study.
properties.location_description: S Steele St, S 45th St, S Lawrence St, and S 36th St
properties.project_rationale: The purpose of the Loop Road Active Transportation Plan is to conduct outreach and develop design concepts that can be implemented in later construction of the Loop Road Active Transportation facilities. The Loop Road will create a connected network of low traffic stress facilities that promote and facilitate active transportation within the Tacoma Mall Area. The need for improving active transportation options in the Tacoma Mall Area via a Loop Road concept arises from several critical factors all of which disproportionately affect marginalized communities who are present in the area at number far above the regional average.
properties.phase_notes: The Planning phase will be funded by a federal grant.

properties.projname: Union Avenue: South 19th to Center Street
properties.project_description: This project includes rehabilitation of Union Ave from S 19th to SR16 and includes new asphalt, ADA compliant curb ramps, and driveway approaches.
properties.project_rationale: Roadway is in poor condition and grant opportunities are available. Extends improvements from where prior work was completed by developer to SR16.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: West Road and the retaining wall that is supporting the road is showing distress over time. These funds will help determine the cause of the failure and the cost to replace the structures.
properties.location_description: West Rd between Yakima Ave and North Rd
properties.project_rationale: If this road and wall continue as is without any maintenance, the wall will most likely fail at some time in the future, leaving the nearby residents severely impacted along with some of the utilities that are in the road.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: Pedestrian Crossing Improvement Project Phase II
properties.project_description: This project improves pedestrian crossings at intersections across the City.
properties.project_rationale: Policy/Legislative Requirements, City Council Directives, Comprehensive Plan Policy CF-EDNR3 states: Encourage capital improvemnets in areas in need of neighborhood revitalization and provide services to neighborhoods
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: South 86th: Thompson to Yakima & South Thompson: 86th to 84th

properties.location_description: S 86th St from Thompson to Yakima Ave
properties.project_rationale: Many children walk in this area between the schools.

properties.project_rationale: This project is needed to improve traffic operations and accommodate the Tacoma Mall Regional Growth Center.

properties.projname: South 74th Street: Tacoma Mall Blvd to West City Limits

properties.location_description: Sherman (T west to dead end), 38th (T to Roosevelt), George (Roosevelt east to dead end), and Roosevelt (Sherman to Fairbanks). Area of E Roosevelt Ave from Sherman to 38th is now part of different project.

properties.project_rationale: This project will improve neighborhood access.
properties.phase_notes: The project is constructed and a hearing will be scheduled in 2025 to confirm final assessments.

properties.project_description: This project is a grind and overlay of Proctor St from N 38th to and including the cul de sac.  Project is constructed and will go to final hearing in 2025.

properties.project_rationale: A majority of property owners signed an advisory survey requesting permanent pavement for their gravel street surface. Substantial completion issued 1/2/2019.
properties.phase_notes: The project is constructed and a hearing will be scheduled in 2025 to confirm final assessments.

properties.project_description: This project will install accessible pedestrian signals that communicate to all users, even those with hearing or vision impairments. These accessible pedestrian signals, known as APS, convey signal information in audible and vibrotactile formats.
properties.project_rationale: The City of Tacoma has 337 signalized intersections. The majority of these intersections do not have accessible pedestrian push buttons and do not effectively communicate with people who have low vision or are deaf/blind.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This program seeks to provide curb ramps to improve access to sidewalks, transit, and other essential facilities.
properties.project_rationale: The Americans with Disabilities Act requires state and local governments to prioritize the removal of barriers to accessibility. When a person with a disability makes a request for a curb ramp, the City is required to respond in a timely manner.
properties.phase_notes: This program plans to construct 30 curb ramps in 2025. Future curb ramps will be constructed based on available funding and requests, with priority given to improving access for people with mobility issues.

properties.project_description: This project upgrades various existing gravel roads across the city to paved roads with associated stormwater upgrades, signage, and other requirements.
properties.project_rationale: Policy/Legislative Requirements, Community Requests, Operation Maintenance Needs, City Council Directives
properties.phase_notes: This project is ongoing.

properties.project_description: This project addresses environmental outfall concerns in the Foss Waterway.
properties.project_rationale: This is an environmental project.
properties.phase_notes: This project is in the planning phase and proposed for funding in the 2025-2026 Biennium.

properties.project_description: This project would improve safety on the corridor by calming traffic, adding bicycle facilities, and building pedestrian safety and access improvements; this project is likely to be phased.
properties.location_description: S 74th Street between west city limits and I-5; S 72nd St between I-5 and east city limits
properties.project_rationale: This project would improve corridor safety by calming traffic, adding bicyle facilities, and building pedestrian safety and access improvements, including signals and refuge islands, to transit and other key destinations.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: Tacoma Dome Link Extension Station Access
properties.project_description: This project improves access to the Tacoma Dome and planned Portland Ave Tacoma Dome Link Extension stations, including ADA access, pedestrian enhancements, new/improved bikeways, & transit access.
properties.project_rationale: This project will help enhance safety and improve multimodal access to transit. It is being planned in partnership with Sound Transit.
properties.phase_notes: This project is in the planning phase.  Sound Transit is actively working with the City to identify potential projects.

properties.projname: Separated Bikeway on Tyler St: S 19th St - S 74th St
properties.project_description: This project will design and construct a separated bikeway on S Tyler St, filling a missing link between S 19th St and S Wright Ave and adding protection to existing painted bike lanes from S Wright Ave to S 74th St. This project is likely to be phased.
properties.location_description: Tyler St from S 19th St to S 74th St
properties.project_rationale: This project completes a continuous north-south bicycle connection, providing access to schools, the Scott Pierson Trail, parks and other community destinations. This has safety, climate, and equity benefits.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: S Hosmer St Vision Zero Improvements (S 72nd St - Tacoma City Limits)
properties.project_description: This project is intended to improve safety and active transportation access on S Hosmer St - with a particular focus on pedestrian safety, ADA accessibility, and crossings.
properties.location_description: S Hosmer St from S 72nd St -to southern city limits
properties.project_rationale: Almost the entirety of Hosmer St is included on the Vision Zero High Risk Network. Like all Tacoma roads - but particularly important on our busiest streets - pedestrian access and safety along the corridor and at crossings are priorities.
properties.phase_notes: Currently unfunded; PW Transportation submitted a proposal to add this project to the PSRC Regional Capacity Project List in 2024, making it eligible for future grant funding

properties.projname: S 11th St/S 12th St Active Transportation Improvements: Jackson Ave - Murray Morgan Bridge
properties.project_description: This project would construct separated bike lanes and pedestrian improvements on S 11th St and S 12th St, filling in missing links and creating a continuous east-west active transportation route from Jackson Ave to the Murray Morgan Bridge.
properties.location_description: S 11th St/S 12th St: Jackson Ave - Murray Morgan Bridge
properties.project_rationale: This project would enhance multimodal safety and access and create a key east-west active transportation
properties.phase_notes: The City has a funded separated bike lane couplet on S 11th & S 12th St from J St - Grant Ave - this project would fill in missing links to create a continuous active transportation route.

properties.projname: Bicycle & Pedestrian Education, Encouragement, and Safety Program
properties.project_description: This project will reduce barriers to using active transportation and transit through programs such as outreach events, education, and the City's bike parking program. This programming supports the City's compliance with the state Commute Trip Reduction law and helps Tacoma meet our equity, safety, and environmental goals.
properties.project_rationale: This program provides bicycle parking where needed around Tacoma, supporting the Commute Trip Reduction law and the City's equity, environmental and community engagement goals. This also consists of education and outreach related to bike and pedestrian safety and mobility and reducing barriers to using active transportation.
properties.phase_notes: Implementation is ongoing  - this funding is used for annual Bike Month events, the City's free bike rack program, and active transportation outreach and education.

properties.project_description: This project is a partnership with the Puyallup Tribe of Indians to reconstruct Browning St from Grandview Ave E to Pioneer Way. The improvements will include sidewalks, stormwater, turn lanes, and signalization.
properties.location_description: Browning St between Grandview and Pioneer Way
properties.project_rationale: This project is a partnership with the Puyallup Tribe of Indians to improve access to their facilities (e.g. Chief Leschi School, Administration, Clinic, Court, etc.).
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: As part of the streets initiative approved by voters in November 2015, the City committed to contribute $30 M over 10 years.
properties.project_rationale: The City committed to contribute $30 M over 10 years for street repair and maintenance as part of Proposition 3 and Proposition A, approved by voters in 2015.
properties.phase_notes: Funding revenues for Streets Initiative 1 end in 2026.

properties.projname: Safe Routes to School Infrastructure Assessment
properties.project_description: This project includes identifying, assessing, and developing a cost estimate for needed infrastructure improvements at 10 schools per year, which provides for opportunities to partner.
properties.project_rationale: This project will address community requests for safer routes to schools and supports Transportation Master Plan policy 2.6 Safer Routes to School.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded.

properties.projname: South Sound Freight Priority Modeling & Capital Planning
properties.project_description: This project will develop a South Sound freight travel demand model.
properties.project_rationale: This project is a tool that helps agencies make informed decisions on prioritization and optimization of transportation facilities related to freight.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently funded.

properties.project_description: This project will construct a new overpass from southbound I-5 at S 38th St to Tacoma Mall Blvd. It will include roadway modifications, new signals, streetlighting, landscaping, and utility work.
properties.project_rationale: This project is included in the Tacoma Mall Subarea Plan. It addresses traffic congestion, active transportation access, and economic development.
properties.phase_notes: The design and construction phase is currently unfunded.

properties.project_description: This project designs and constructs guardrails, fences, medians, islands, and other vehicle/bicycle/pedestrian barriers for safety and mobility.
properties.project_rationale: This project will address the need street improvement such as barriers for safe vehicle, pedestrian, and bicycle access.
properties.phase_notes: Guardrails on McMurray Rd have been identified for repair/replacement.

properties.project_description: This project is led by Metro Parks Tacoma and will complete design and permitting, and will construct a bike and pedestrian bridge at Swan Creek Park. Additional improvements to connect to Pipeline Trail are planned.
properties.location_description: Swan Creek Park - 6105 E ROOSEVELT AVE
properties.project_rationale: This project would provide access to Swan Creek Park, Pipeline Trail, and Lister Elementary School.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded and would be a partnership with Metro Parks Tacoma.

properties.projname: Titlow Park: Hidden Beach Bridge Replacement
properties.project_description: This project is led by Metro Palrks Tacoma and will complete design and permitting to replace the failing bridge that crosses a busy railroad track that provides access to North Hidden Beach.
properties.project_rationale: This project would replace a failing bridge that provides recreational access, as well as, access to conduct shoreline restoration.
properties.phase_notes: This project is currently unfunded and would be a partnership with Metro Parks Tacoma.

properties.project_description: This project will implement strategies outlined in the Safe Routes to School Action Plan and construct improvements at schools throughout the City.
properties.project_rationale: This project will address community requests for Safer Routes to Schools and supports Transportation Master Plan policy 2.6 Safer Routes to Schools.
properties.phase_notes: Stewart MS, Roosevelt ES, Fernhill ES, and Giadrone MS are in the planning phase.  25-26 funding is for construction at Giadrone MS and Fernhill ES. This program aims to address routes at 13 of 53 schools.

properties.project_rationale: This project works toward eliminating traffic related fatalities and serious injuries.
properties.phase_notes: Project aims to implement specific improvements identified in the Vision Zero Action Plan.

properties.project_description: This project identifies funds to be used for grant match opportunities contingent on receiving grants from higher levels of government.
properties.project_rationale: The City can leverage its funds to pursue grant funding. These funds can help the City stretch its dollars to complete projects.
properties.phase_notes: Funds will be allocated to projects as opportunities found and awards are made.

properties.projname: Sound Transit STSA - South Pine Street
properties.project_description: The South Pine Street project will provide protected bike lanes, transitioning to a shared use path, on S Pine St. between S Center St. and S 47th St. by removing a travel lane in each direction. The project scope also includes sidewalk and ADA enhancements, improving existing and adding additional bicycle and pedestrian crossing opportunities, and transit stop improvements.
properties.location_description: A section of South Pine Street between South Center Street and South 47th Street
properties.project_rationale: This project will help address safety and accessibility disparities in South Tacoma. It is being planned in partnership with Sound Transit.

properties.project_description: The project will include a planning study. The purpose of the study would be to determine what use or uses would best serve the community, such as new roadway connections to improve connectivity and mobility, converting the property to a linear park or trail, or selling portions of the property. Enhancements to remove rails to enhance safety, mobility, and accessibility along the corridor will also be explored. This project also includes property management and maintenance, and finalization of agreements.
properties.location_description: Tacoma Rail Mountain Division right-of-way within Tacoma City Limits
properties.project_rationale:
In 2023, the City sold portions of TRMW outside of the City limits, necessary to support the customer base in Frederickson, and successfully petitioned the Surface Transportation Board to discontinue operations on the retained TRMW segments inside the City limits.

The City has reserved a portion of the proceeds from the sale to conduct a study of the rail line segments that were retained within the City.  While service on TRMW within the City limits has been discontinued, it is not abandoned, and STB could require rail operations resume in the future. The purpose of the study would be to determine what use or uses would best serve the community, such as new roadway connections to improve connectivity and mobility, converting the property to a linear park or trail, or selling portions of the property. While funding is available for the study, funds are not currently identified for any improvements identified during the study. Additionally, if the study concludes the best public use is not rail operations, the City will need to obtain approval to abandon this facility before other uses can begin.
properties.phase_notes: This project is in the planning phase and is expected to hire a consultant to assist with community engagement for Winter 2025.
